feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 6:50AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Very Stormy from Wednesday Night Through Thursday... From Wednesday into the weekend, a series of very strong Bering Sea storms will bring gales and heavy rain to Western Alaska. A weak low now over Kamchatka will deepen rapidly and move to the Central Bering Sea on Wed, and to the Northern Bering Sea on Thu. This will spread rain to the West Coast Wed night and Thu. This
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 6:45AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Precipitation Wednesday and Wednesday Night... A weather system in the Gulf of Alaska will move over the Eastern Alaska Range tonight, and then over the Fairbanks area on Wed and Wed night before moving east on Thu. This will bring between 0.25-0.50 inch of rain to much of the Eastern Interior, and up to one inch possible in the White Mountains. With snow level falling to
entry.cap:areaDesc: Middle Tanana Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 6:45AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Precipitation Late tonight through Wednesday Night... A weather system in the Gulf of Alaska will move over the Eastern Alaska Range tonight, and then over the Fairbanks area on Wed and Wed night before moving east on Thu. This will bring over one inch of rain to the Alaska Range between Delta and Kantishna.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 9:53AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Coconino and Yavapai Counties near Paulden through 1030 AM MST... At 952 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Paulden, or 8 miles north of Chino Valley, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, half inch hail, and heavy rain.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 3:22AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Wildfire Smoke and Air Quality Impacts... * Smoke from the Mosquito wildfire continues to produce unhealthy to hazardous air quality across many areas this morning. The latest observations indicate the worst conditions to be concentrated near Truckee and extending into Reno, Sparks, and the North Valleys. Visibility of 2-3 miles in smoke is in place

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 12:35PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Miami-Dade County through 115 PM EDT... At 1235 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud over Miami Springs, or over Hialeah, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Coastal Miami Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metro Broward County; Metropolitan Miami Dade

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 12:46PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Thunderstorms Possible Through 2 PM... Scattered thunderstorms over the area this afternoon will produce a half inch of rain in less than 30 minutes for some sites...and the stronger storms could also include pea sized hail and or wind gusts to 40 mph. The storms will generally move to the north at 10 to 15 mph.
